rights.description: Authority must permit inspection or provide copies as soon as practicable and without delay
rights.implementation_notes: Generally interpreted as within 10 business days for simple requests; complex requests may require additional reasonable time with notice
rights.request_tips: Cite 'as soon as practicable and without delay' standard if agency delays unreasonably

rights.description: May only charge for location costs if cost exceeds $50; must provide written estimate
rights.conditions: Location costs must exceed $50 threshold before charges apply
rights.implementation_notes: This protects requesters from search fees on most requests
rights.request_tips: If charged for search/location, verify costs exceed $50 and request written cost estimate

rights.description: Cannot charge for inspection; cannot require prepayment for inspection
rights.conditions: No conditions - inspection is always free
rights.implementation_notes: Only copy/reproduction fees may be charged, not inspection
rights.request_tips: Request in-person inspection to avoid all fees; agency cannot charge for viewing records

rights.description: Reasonable attorney fees, damages, and costs awarded to requester if substantially prevails; minimum $100 damages for arbitrary denials
rights.conditions: Must substantially prevail in mandamus action
rights.implementation_notes: This creates strong disincentive for arbitrary denials
rights.request_tips: If considering litigation, know that you can recover attorney fees plus minimum $100 if denial was arbitrary

rights.description: Authority bears burden to prove record is exempt from disclosure
rights.implementation_notes: Requester does not need to prove entitlement - agency must justify denial
rights.request_tips: If denied, agency must prove exemption applies; you do not have burden to justify request

rights.description: No specific form required; requests may be oral or written; no identification or purpose statement required
rights.applies_to: All requesters except committed/incarcerated persons (unless requesting own records)
rights.implementation_notes: Written requests recommended for documentation purposes
rights.request_tips: You do not need to identify yourself or state why you want records; oral requests are acceptable

rights.description: If information stored electronically, authority must create electronic record if creation doesn't unduly burden authority
rights.conditions: Creation must be feasible and not unduly burdensome
rights.implementation_notes: Agencies cannot refuse electronic format if technically feasible
rights.request_tips: Request electronic format for records stored electronically; cite this provision if denied

rights.description: Law construed with presumption of complete public access; denial contrary to public interest except in exceptional cases
rights.implementation_notes: This creates strong presumption in favor of disclosure
rights.request_tips: Cite presumption of complete public access when challenging exemption claims

rights.description: Authority cannot destroy records for at least 60 days after denying access to requested record
rights.implementation_notes: Protects ability to litigate denials by preserving records during appeal period
rights.request_tips: If denied, records cannot be destroyed for 60 days - providing time to challenge denial

rights.description: For records designated confidential by statute, balancing test may permit access if public interest in disclosure outweighs confidentiality interest
rights.implementation_notes: Even confidential records may be disclosed if public interest outweighs confidentiality
rights.request_tips: If denied based on confidentiality statute, argue public interest outweighs confidentiality concern

rights.description: If only part of record subject to disclosure, authority must delete confidential information and provide access to remainder
rights.conditions: Applies when record contains both public and exempt information
rights.implementation_notes: Agencies cannot withhold entire record if only portion is exempt
rights.request_tips: If denied, ask whether any portion is disclosable; agency must segregate and redact rather than withhold entirely

rights.description: Authority must post notice describing organization, access times/places, methods, and responsible officers/employees
rights.implementation_notes: Provides transparency about how to submit requests
rights.request_tips: Check posted notice to identify designated records officer and submission procedures

validation_metadata.notes: All rights extracted from verified jurisdiction-data.json file. Wisconsin has particularly strong requester protections including presumption of complete public access, minimum damages for arbitrary denials, and balancing test for confidential records.
